website_summaries.verdict: Worth a try if you only plan to use it indoors and don't have a major bug problem; otherwise we recommend other Dynatrap models that are more versatile.
pros: Stands out for the indoor design that features slim construction and 1000 sq
Owners have reported fewer flying bugs in their homes after using it
cons: Doesn't work as well at trapping larger insects

customer_reviews.title: GREAT product if placed AWAY from sleeping area
customer_reviews.text: Cannot say enough good things about this product. It is used in area with Mosquitos !! After experimentation with using it in bedrooms, if is now ensconced in main room in a corner, intercepting insects. Notes: Mosquitoes are attracted in human breath but more importantly in this case, to light. So if mosquitoes are a nuisance in the bedroom, don't use lights there!! includes TVs and nightlights. If must use, leave room dark until ready for bed, and turn off after use. Put the Dynatrap AWAY from the bedroom, as it will attract any mosquitoes in the home and they will be happy to find lunch before the "blue light."
customer_reviews.author: Desert  Nurse Practitioner

customer_reviews.title: Dyna Indoor Trap Works just Fine
customer_reviews.text: I always forget to close doors and insects follow. At night while reading or watching TV they come out and pester. Sprays are not used due to allergies. The simple answer was to close the doors after entering, however since that did not work the Trap works just fine. It is efficient, quiet and disposed our home with ease of turning on and off as needed. PS the no zap is a great feature. I suggest you read and follow the instructions about competing lights, this is very important. Very Happy.
customer_reviews.author: Retired Old Fart

customer_reviews.title: Works if you add an attractant, the UV lamp alone did not attract mosquitoes
customer_reviews.text: By itself the trap was ineffective for mosquitoes in my case, however, I dropped an octenol attractant cartridge from my outside unit into the base/trap area and voila', I had two winged prisoners within an hour. I also "built" one of the 2 liter soda bottle hacks/trap next to it with yeast, sugar and water to increase the CO2 (bait) in the area.
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: Really Works!
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! I plugged it in at the beginning of the summer, placed it in a central location, and let it run 24/7, it has caught about 90% of the mosquitos that have found their way into my house The photo is deceptive, because you can't see all the really tiny mosquitos. Be aware that this trap can't compete with me when it comes to attracting mosquitoes; if the trap and I are in close proximity, the mosquito will choose me every time. (if the Trap emitted enough CO2 to be competition for a human it wouldn't be safe to use inside a house). Consequently, the trap is not in my bedroom. I
customer_reviews.author: Delia Story

customer_reviews.title: We've been dealing with some mosquito issues in our neighborhood ...
customer_reviews.text: We've been dealing with some mosquito issues in our neighborhood. We have screens, don't leave doors open for any longer than it takes to go in and out. However, mosquitos keep getting in to our apartment. We set up the Dynatrap for a few days, but they didn't attract any mosquitos---though we saw several and killed them ourselves. Our next-door neighbor reported the same results. So we returned the trap. This may work for severe infestations; at some point, the trap will likely snag a few. We also weren't thrilled with leaving the trap running 24/7 and hearing that low humming around the clock.
customer_reviews.author: Eileen Bermingham

customer_reviews.title: This product is a waste of money and doesn't perform as stated in product description
customer_reviews.text: This "insect trap/eliminator" is a joke. We purchased this product in good faith that it would provide some measure of relief from flying insects in our home. However, the insects would actually fly all around this unit and not be vacuumed into the desiccation portion of this waste of money. Mosquitos, small flys, small moths - NOTHING, not one of these were collected into the unit. Don't waste money or time on this disappointing product.
customer_reviews.author: yoginime

customer_reviews.title: They have been bought out by Woodstream Corporation, no longer can recommend
customer_reviews.text: What I did like about this unit that it did work and it was made by DynaTrap an name that could be trusted. Not anymore, before you could order replacement parts like the fan unit, automatic damper, and wall mount. There customer service don't care anymore. Why spend $10 for an replacement fan when with Woodstream Corporation you can spend $100 off their website or $89.99 here on amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Ion88

customer_reviews.title: It's OK.
customer_reviews.text: Our problem was mosquitos in our bedroom at night. In desperation we bought the Dynatrap DT250IN. Results were disappointing at first, but we found a way to use it that worked fairly well for us. We left it on 24/7 on top of the dresser, with no other lights on (except a few brief periods) and the bedroom door closed all day and night. Sounds weird, but this way it caught most of the mosquitos and we only had 1-2 bugs each day to zap manually with the racket-like device.
customer_reviews.author: Zee

customer_reviews.title: I have several sizes of this item and all work ...
customer_reviews.text: I have several sizes of this item and all work. We have a cabin in the woods with lots of little flying bugs, this item works both inside and outside. The constantly running fan is quiet but noticeable (not too bad). The unit needs to run continuously because when you turn it off, any bugs still living will just fly out (bugs are trapped by the fan/vacuum but not killed right away).
customer_reviews.author: Larry Ayers

customer_reviews.title: Great for Asian Lady Bugs
customer_reviews.text: We bought this appliance for one reason only. Asian Lady Bugs. In the fall the lady bugs start trying to find a place to stay for the winter. They really like our house and were really getting to be a nuisance. We were getting hundreds in our master bath. When we installed the Dynatrap (we call it the bug-a-nater) the bugs came right to it. Problem solved. We sprayed a little crawling insect pesticide in the trap portion which makes it easier to empty the trap since all the bugs will be dead. Simply remove the bottom with one twist and flush the bugs down the toilet.
customer_reviews.author: George Wallace

customer_reviews.title: Dynatrap really works!!
customer_reviews.text: This product actually works!! Living along the Texas Gulf coast means mosquitoes....a lot of mosquitoes!! We have three of these in our home, two downstairs and one in the second floor hall and they have helped a great deal. They also trap other annoying flying insects as well. The light should be changed at regular intervals and the machine cleaned out...a small price to pay for keeping mosquitoes from biting the family. There is also an outdoor version we are considering for the back yard.
customer_reviews.author: The Hills

customer_reviews.title: Not so quiet
customer_reviews.text: I liked this product but I didnt love it. It did catch some flies, but it was not as quiet as they say and I felt like I had to keep moving it to find a good spot for it.
customer_reviews.author: Tania Srouji

customer_reviews.title: The product is good and they work OK
customer_reviews.text: The product is good and they work OK, just not as well as I had hoped. Either my frustration was too great or my expectations were too high. I like them much better than a zapper and for the record, I still keep them pugged in.
customer_reviews.author: KS Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Works pretty well. Make sure you go outside with the ...
customer_reviews.text: Works pretty well. Make sure you go outside with the entire trap before taking the catch basket off to empty or some live ones may escape if using it indoors, and then click the basket back on *firmly* or when your girlfriend knocks it off the counter and spills dead and living flies everywhere, she'll be angry at you.
customer_reviews.author: Frustrated Cynic

customer_reviews.title: Super Great Product
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product!!! I have a huge mosquito problem and this devise works great!!! Since I purchased I have NOT been bitten once by the little 'vampires' Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Too Tall

customer_reviews.title: Dynatrap rocks!
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these in my house at all times, one upstairs and one downstairs. They catch those pesky mosquitoes that sneak inside your house when the door opens. I can't stand to have a mosquito buzz in my ear when I am going to bed. This catches them and moths too. I have given one to each of my children for their homes and I also have 2 of the outdoor Dynatraps that cuts down on yard mosquitoes. It catches all kinds of pests including beetles in my rose garden. I love this product.
customer_reviews.author: Bayshore Rose

customer_reviews.title: Important you do not have competing light sources.
customer_reviews.text: Having seen many of these products come and go, we have been amazed by the effectiveness of this device.We somehow have had an infestation of Pantry Moths of a completely unknown origin, but, living in a very rural area, pests are almost inevitable.We have tried everything, from traps, delta dust, lavender, you name it. This has eliminated about 98% of the Moths, and a fly swatter can get the remaining sluggish critters.(Fortunately,they are slow,easy targets. Unfortunately, there is this smudge of black moth dust wherever you nail the little devils.) Remember , the light is the magnet, so it is important to not have any competing light sources, so, we only use the trap at night.
customer_reviews.author: Docntx

customer_reviews.title: Great product !
customer_reviews.text: Great product ! Easy to use and clean. This is my third one over the many years. It catches the bugs 🙂
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Crack Fan
customer_reviews.text: So today my dynatrap has be making a crackling noise. So i cleaned it, i thought it just caught a big insect but upon checking inside, I saw a crack on the fan. I'm still in warranty right? You don't have to replace my unit, but i just need a replacement fan.
customer_reviews.author: Nerceo

customer_reviews.title: Mostly satisfied just to much motor noise
customer_reviews.text: Works well just loud when in operation, indoor use should be as quiet as my outdoor Dynamic product
customer_reviews.author: John R Paul

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy it, totally waste of money!
customer_reviews.text: It's a good quality and nice looking product except it does not catch any mosquitoes. I have this in the house for about a week and it did not catch a single mosquito! then I took it outside, left it on my patio for few nights and still nothing. Totally waste of money!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing! Anything flying around the house finds itself inside the trap. Nice!
customer_reviews.author: Sharon H.

customer_reviews.title: Worked but did not eliminate the issue completly
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to address moths in the house, which got infected by food grains bought from a store. The product did work for a while and did capture some of the bugs but not completely. I guess there is a additional need to put some commercial chemical traps to be placed inside to force attract all the insects
customer_reviews.author: J V

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT attract or catch Mosquitos AT ALL.. ...
customer_reviews.text: Does NOT attract or catch Mosquitos AT ALL... SAME FOR 3 INDOOR TRAPS THAT I BOUGHT "ESPECIALLY THE SMALLER INDOOR ONE, and these large indoor one's in a small bedroom
customer_reviews.author: NCLREZ

customer_reviews.title: DIdn't work for me
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't get this thing to work, sent it back. We live in SW Virginia... despite online rumors I read, this didn't interest stink bugs at all and other bugs were kinda flying around it also. I wanted it to work... disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Erin S. Contour

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't really work in the house - does not help with nats at all.
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: Does Not Work on Flies - waste of money!
customer_reviews.text: Got this yesterday (July 18,2018). We have a fly problem in our house. This thing doesn’t work at all. Trying to figure out if I can return it. I don’t recommend at all.
customer_reviews.author: SrExecwithMBA

customer_reviews.title: It could perform better
customer_reviews.text: For the first few days, the mosquito populations decreased, but it increased again. I discover that, if I move it from time to time, it works better.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie

customer_reviews.title: It works somewhat
customer_reviews.text: I have received this dynatrap and cut on. A couple days later l have seen a mat gnat on the stand where dynatrap is placed. I think the manage to escape.
customer_reviews.author: Akeem

customer_reviews.title: It works but not that great. For every one beetle it catches there are ...
customer_reviews.text: It works but not that great. For every one beetle it catches there are 5 it does't. I even leave it running at night with every other light off and they still do not go to it. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Dani Dansby

customer_reviews.title: this one is working fairly well, it catches two ...
customer_reviews.text: this one is working fairly well, it catches two or three mosquitos a day , I followed the placement ideas , I'm thinking of a second and maybe third one for the other end of the house and the garage
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Works well if no human is close by. When ...
customer_reviews.text: Works well if no human is close by. When a human is in the same room then mosquitoes are clearly more attracted to the living, breathing thing.
customer_reviews.author: GW

customer_reviews.title: Re: Buying a second one for the upstairs
customer_reviews.text: We hooked it up and within 30 seconds it had already sucked in a mosquito. I was sold! And I had my doubts because the other bug trap we bought was put in a closed bathroom with a mosquito for TWO DAYS and it caught nothing. But this one works... YAY!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Harris

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great catches all inside insects easy to keep clean.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Voorhees

customer_reviews.title: We'll never know
customer_reviews.text: I'm not saying that this thing can't catch bugs. I'm just saying that it didn't. $100 is a lot of money for a lamp.
customer_reviews.author: C. Potter

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in this product. Don't waste your money on it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Didn't capture blood suckers only light bugs
customer_reviews.text: (If you're looking to get rid of mosquitoes I would recommend you go for the breeding ground instead of trying to capture them afterward) I bought this product with the hopes that it would get rid of all the mosquitoes in my very small home. When it arrived I was very excited to set it up, set up was very easy pretty much plug-and-play. It's been running for about a month now (non stop, except for cleaning) and it has not caught a single mosquito. I spent the $80 on this one versus buying a regular bug zapper because it was supposedly specifically for mosquitoes. Thus far it has only caught small light bugs. About 20 of them total.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Not that good...still getting eaten alive...
customer_reviews.text: it does not do what it says. we have given it several months and there are a couple bugs in there but we continue to get eaten alive by mosquitoes.
customer_reviews.author: ABGordon

customer_reviews.title: Not for Mosquitoes
customer_reviews.text: I had this trap in my garage where there are a lot of mosquitoes. I caught two little moths but no mosquitoes. I also tried the trap indoors when I saw a mosquito in the living room. This is the fourth day and nothing, but to be fair, perhaps the mosquito just dropped dead from fear after seeing the trap as I have not seen it after the first time. I will put the trap back in the garage in a different location (I tried two locations already) and see how it goes. As I really don't believe the trap has any "fear" factor...I am not very hopeful.
customer_reviews.author: kt808

customer_reviews.title: Underwhelmed; Doesn't work for mosquitoes
customer_reviews.text: Got thefor my mom three months ago, for use indoors, but I think it comes in handy mostly as a night light. It trapped the stray mosquito here and there (there were/are plenty), but not nearly enough to warrant the price. Maybe it works better for other insects (don't know), but not for mosquitoes.
customer_reviews.author: dingbat

customer_reviews.title: just put one in the house
customer_reviews.text: we live in the country and have grandchildren in and out I clipped the fly sex lure on it and the flies are going for it. It is quite and has a catching basket in the bottom that is easy to empty.
customer_reviews.author: Ann Collins

customer_reviews.title: Frustrated
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed in this product. Did not really catch insects nor mosquitos to any degree. Tried using for the last 9 months. Throwing away
customer_reviews.author: Alegandron

customer_reviews.title: DYNATRAP indoor flying insect eliminator  IT REALLY WORKS
customer_reviews.text: I would highly recommend this insect eliminator, it actually works, it draws the insects to the ultra violet light, its quiet, we haven't seen anything flying around . This unit replace one that made a humming sound when turned on and required a water tray. this one is a no hassle unit. all is required is that it be plugged into an electrical outlet. I'm considering buying another one to put in the work shop.
customer_reviews.author: EC

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend this device in the gnats zone
customer_reviews.text: The dynotrap is a silent bug killer and it catches flies and gnats. It has kept the pest out of my eyes and ears and away from my dogs. Works.usually within 24 hrs in the house. I would recommend this device in the gnats zone.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Whitehead

customer_reviews.title: Did not work for me
customer_reviews.text: I've read that this device works for some people, but it did not work for me. I ran it continuously for almost two weeks, following instructions, and it did not trap anything. I have mosquitoes in my apartment (even at this colder time of year), and they're still biting me at night. I tried this device in hopes it would remove at least some, but the trap compartment has been empty since I started using it. It did not trap anything.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon King

customer_reviews.title: Gets the bugs!
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this product. Have had problems with mosquitoes and fruit flies in the house for years....tried cheaper brands/models of indoor bug zappers that just did not last. I thought I would be limited by the fact it is not battery powered, but have had no issues. The cord is long, the machine is light and easily moved where needed. And you can keep it on 24/7 (which is recommended) and I think that makes a big difference. Worth the price!
customer_reviews.author: Kristin

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work
customer_reviews.text: Does not work. Caught 2 flies in a week. There were at least 10 in the kitchen and they didn’t go near it.
customer_reviews.author: Lori

customer_reviews.title: Makes a Nice Night Light
customer_reviews.text: It makes a nice night light but doesn't catch many insects. It does catch a few, though, and it looks nice, so I kept it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Leahy

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I used this inside a concession stand during the summer. It worked well and eliminated the flies even around food. We just put it off in the corner and let it do it's thing. We did not want to use fly paper around food and this worked very well for us.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne Hendrickson

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I have Zero bugs in my garage. Bought another one for my Outdoor Workshop. No bugs. Perfect
customer_reviews.author: colleen presbrey

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Am very pleased with this purchase. I ordered Inadays but wish I ordered this first.
customer_reviews.author: Yuna YJ Pak

customer_reviews.title: Dynatrap indoor flying insect trap
customer_reviews.text: The trap is quiet but does not perform up to the expectation. The price is too much compared to the work it does.
customer_reviews.author: Yamina

customer_reviews.title: Bulb went out after six months, replacement doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: Beneficial, but not worth the money if the bulb power supply stops working after six months. I ordered a replacement bulb, it does not work. I don't know what the warranty is on the original unit. I do not recommend buying this at this time.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Laubach

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work for moths.
customer_reviews.text: I got this trap to take care of a sudden infestation of brown moths inside my home. There were dozens flying around at any given time. I ran the trap in various conditions (placement in the room - corner, center, high, low, etc.), but it only caught one moth in two weeks! Maybe it works for other flying bugs....
customer_reviews.author: Jd.22

customer_reviews.title: It is catching the bugs that come in the door with the dogs.
customer_reviews.text: I live on a canal close to the beach in Florida. This time of year we have a lot of rain and a lot of mosquitoes and gnats which come in the door every time the dogs go in or out. I was being bothered by both until I set up the dynatrap.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy

customer_reviews.title: Total failure
customer_reviews.text: This was absolute garbage, my beer bottle trap outperformed this trap by 400%. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: MisesianTexan

customer_reviews.title: It works great on moths and flies
customer_reviews.text: It did not attract, trap and kill mosquitos as advertised. I had it turned on for a week and the room was full of mosquitos and none were caught. It works great on moths and flies.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia White

customer_reviews.title: Does not catch mosquitos I should have listened to other ...
customer_reviews.text: Does not catch mosquitos I should have listened to other reviewers!
customer_reviews.author: Island girl

customer_reviews.title: Great for ladybugs!
customer_reviews.text: This trap is AMAZING! I had a huge amount of lady bugs that had made their way into the house in the fall and this trap did the trick. I will post s picture of the trap before I empty it.
customer_reviews.author: BigBadWolfe

customer_reviews.title: hate those skeeters
customer_reviews.text: I don't think this works. It traps many flying bugs, and maybe a few mosquitos. I used it in NH for the summer and it seemed to get a few skeeters. I looked through the dead bugs with a hand lens and found some dead skeeters. BUT in Florida, it doesn't do much at all. I have enhanced the device with some other attractants, such a limburger cheese, smelly shoes, and Lurex from Mosquito Magnet. Not any impressive results. STill working on it, but sorry to say this device clearly is not the answer to your Mosquito problems. Wish were, hate those skeeters!
customer_reviews.author: John Fuller

customer_reviews.title: Broken on arrival
customer_reviews.text: I bought this one to replace one that broke after a year of use. It wasn't the bulb either. I plugged my new one in and only the fan worked. I had to pay to return it. The return postage was $17. I won't buy from them again. Amazon Returns need to do better.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Extremely disappointed in this product. Does not work as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: wintermaiden

customer_reviews.title: dont bother buying this
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed with the product ...the fan was weak bugs flew in and right back out..I ended up having to buy other products such as sprays and sticky tapes ...those worked better
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I had high hopes that thus would work,
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes that thus would work, but instead the misquotes just fly around bit and bite me
customer_reviews.author: Susan D Pelosi

customer_reviews.title: This is a great produce
customer_reviews.text: In just a few day's the bugs in our house have been zapped! Gone.
customer_reviews.author: David & Susan Coplan

customer_reviews.title: this does not work
customer_reviews.text: This did not work for my issue and it is grossly overpriced for what I received.
customer_reviews.author: la

customer_reviews.title: hoping to find out
customer_reviews.text: i own a bird, and between it being very messy, and its food, mainly seeds, which hatch these lil moth lil critters im hoping this will satisfy my problem :) im thinking it will
customer_reviews.author: Scott Brown

customer_reviews.title: It doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: This new lamp did not work. the light did not work, the lamp recently I made order was to be in good condition
customer_reviews.author: MARISOL LOPEZ

customer_reviews.title: does not work
customer_reviews.text: as others have documented, this product simply does not work. i have tried it in different areas and have never seen a trapped insect. i have other products from dynatrap that have worked well.
customer_reviews.author: DJ Mayer

product_meta.title: DYNAMIC SOLUTIONS WORLDWIDE DT250IN Twist On/Off, 1,000 Square Feet, Black
product_meta.description: Dynatrap Indoor Flying Insect Trap attracts and kills mosquitoes, flies, moths and other common household flying insects. Trap emits light and odorless harmless carbon dioxide to lure insects in, the carbon dioxide is generated when ultraviolet rays from the integrated UV bulb reacts with a titanium dioxide coating inside the trap. Constructed to draw mosquitoes inside, once inside the integrated whisper quiet fan traps the insects and sends them to a removable screened compartment where they die of dehydration. Conveniently weights less than 3lbs and about the size of a large thermos enabling easy portability from room to room with an unobtrusive set up. Covers approximately 1,000 SQFT and plugs into AC with a 7' cord, included. Measures 12-1/2"H x 6"D.
feature_bullets: Indoor trap delivers 3-way protection against mosquitoes and other flying insects
Fluorescent UV light and whisper-quiet fan attract and capture insects without zapping or buzzing
Lightweight, portable insect trap for convenient placement in any room of the house
Protects up to 1,000 square feet; turns on and off with a twist
Mosquito trap requires no attractant or propane

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.6 out of 5 stars135 ratings3.6 out of 5 stars
